intro: Stipa melanosperma, commonly known as black-berry grass, is a perennial grass species native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces dark purple to black颖, which give it its common name. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats.
